titleStmt.title: Via devia: the by-vvay mis-leading the weake and vnstable into dangerous paths of error, by colourable shewes of apocryphall scriptures, vnwritten traditions, doubtfull Fathers, ambiguous councells, and pretended catholike Church. Discouered by Humfrey Lynde, Knight.
titleStmt.author: Lynde, Humphrey, Sir.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Aug. M[athewes]. for Rob. Milbourne, and are to be sold at his shop at the Grayhound in Pauls Churchyard,

notesStmt.note: Item at reel 810:8 identified as STC 17094; STC (2nd ed.) describes that number as a ghost.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
Item at reel 2081:6b with: Via Tuta: The safe way / by Humfrey Lynde. London : Printed by F.K. for Robert Milbourne, 1629.

place.placeName: his shop at the Grayhound in Pauls Churchyard
